meanings.definition: Stand, move, or sit in a lazy, drooping way.
meanings.sent1: He slouched in his chair while watching TV.
meanings.sent2: She always slouched when she felt tired.
meanings.sent3: The cat slouched lazily in the sunbeam.
meanings.sent4: The tree branches slouched under the weight of the snow.
meanings.sent5: The student slouched in his seat, barely paying attention.

meanings.definition: A lazy, drooping posture or movement.
meanings.sent1: Her slouched posture made her look uninterested.
meanings.sent2: The old man's slouched walk showed his fatigue.
meanings.sent3: The slouched figure in the painting seemed to be napping.
meanings.sent4: The slouched position of the scarecrow made it look tired.
meanings.sent5: The slouched stance of the statue gave it a sense of relaxation.
